extra_fields
input.For:
For every field to be extracted, always apply the following rule:
1. **Check the `extra_fields` input first.**  
   If the field exists there and contains a non-empty value, use that value.
2. **Only if the field is missing or empty in `extra_fields`,** proceed to extract it from `adm_email` (the email content).
This rule ensures that user-provided corrections or responses are always prioritized over parsing from the email.

# Extraction Guidance & Examples
input.**NA:
**NA handling:**  
- If the extracted value is exactly any variation of ‚Äúnot available‚Äù (e.g., NA, N/A, n/a, na, n.a., none, not available, not applicable), always output **NA** (uppercase, exact).  For validated picklist fields (Region, Perk Type, Member Target, Code Batch To Be Used), return an empty string `""` instead of NA. Follow this rule like your life depends on it. 
- If no valid value is found or inferred, also return an empty string `""`.  
---
input.Extract: Extract the main promotional link from the email body. Prioritise URLs that follow labels like URL:, Offer link:, or Redeem at:. If none, take the first URL mentioned in the body before the signature or disclaimer. Ignore corporate site links, blogs, or any links in footers/disclaimers. Return only one clean URL; if none is found, return an empty string ("")
input.Return:
Return in the format: `DD/MM/YYYY` (e.g., `30/06/2025`). ¬†
If no end date is found, return an empty string.
input.**Production:
**Production Ops Type:**  
If the email or extra_fields mention a new offer or promotion, output `"Perk Changes"`.  
If it mentions a change or extension to an existing offer, output `"Misc Changes"`.
input.**Contact:
**Contact Email:**  
- Extract from the angle brackets `<...>` in the **From** field of the same partner sender identified in **Contact Name**. 
- Must not end in `@myunidays.com`. ¬†
- If multiple forwarded layers exist, select the email address from the earliest non-UNiDAYS sender in the chain. ¬†
- If no such partner email exists, return an empty string.
input.Search: Search the email content case-insensitively for any of the accepted values: Boost, Additional, Persistent, Hidden. These may appear with or without labels such as ‚ÄúPerk Type‚Äù or ‚ÄúOffer Type,‚Äù and with separators like :, -, or ‚Äì. Also accept contextual phrases like ‚Äúboosted‚Äù ‚Üí Boost, ‚Äúextra‚Äù ‚Üí Additional, ‚Äúevergreen‚Äù or ‚Äúalways on‚Äù ‚Üí Persistent, and ‚Äúunlisted‚Äù ‚Üí Hidden. Always normalize the output to the canonical form (Boost, Additional, Persistent, Hidden). If no valid match is found, return an empty string
input.**Deploy:
**Deploy When Ready (True/False):**  
If `Production Ops Type` = "Misc Changes" ‚Üí always True.
input.If:
If `Production Ops Type` = "Perk Changes" ‚Üí default to False, unless email or extra_fields contain phrases like:
- ‚Äúdeploy when ready‚Äù
- ‚Äúgo live now‚Äù
- ‚Äúlive now‚Äù
- ‚Äúvalid from now‚Äù
- ‚Äúnow until‚Äù
input.-: - Always take the first From: header in the outermost email headers (not from forwarded content).
input.**Region:**:
**Region:**  
Extract region from email/extra_fields, or infer from URL endings.
input.Make:
Make sure to:
Match common short forms like ‚ÄúUK‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúUnited Kingdom‚Äù, ‚ÄúUS‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúUnited States‚Äù, ‚ÄúUAE‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúUnited Arab Emirates‚Äù.
Only return a region if it‚Äôs part of this list (see below). If no match, return an empty string.
input.**End:
**End Time:**  
- Parse from phrases like ‚Äúuntil/by/till‚Äù, ‚Äúvalid until‚Äù, ‚Äúoffer ends at/on‚Äù, or the right side of a range (‚Äúto Y‚Äù).
- If the extracted time is exactly on the hour,  keep it as is. If the extracted time is between hours ‚Üí round up to the next full hour
input.Look:
Look for any phrasing that clearly indicates the **end of the promotion**, such as: ¬†
- ‚Äúvalid until [date]‚Äù
- ‚Äúoffer ends on [date]‚Äù
- ‚Äúexpires on [date]‚Äù
- ‚Äúpromotion available until [date]‚Äù
If multiple such dates are found, select the **latest** one.
input.‚ÄúMidnight‚Äù: ‚ÄúMidnight‚Äù ‚Üí 00:00 on the next day (increment End Date by +1).
input.**Discount-Promotion:**:
**Discount-Promotion:**  
Extract full sentence containing `% off`, `save X`, `discount`, `promotion`, or `offer`.
input.**Member:
**Member Target:**  
Look for `Student` or `Both`.  
If no fuzzy match, return empty.
input.**Code:
**Code Batch To Be Used:**  
Look for keywords like `New`, `Existing`, or `Both`.  
Also accept `"codes - unique"` as `"New"`.
input.**Attachments:
**Attachments (Y/N):**  
If the task_context.attachments array contains at least one object with both a name and a key, output "Y".
Otherwise, output "N".
input.-Only:
-Only accept it if:
The email address ends with @myunidays.com
input.The:
The To: or delivered-to: header contains a Beam shared inbox (beam.ai@myunidays.com or beam@myunidays.com).
Return only the plain email (e.g., safwan.burki@myunidays.com).
If these conditions are not met, return "".
input.**T&Cs:**:
**T&Cs:**  
Extract the wording after "T&Cs", "Terms and conditions", or "Terms & Conditions" ‚Äî only the text that follows those phrases.
input.**Misc:
**Misc Change:**  
Search email/extra_fields for keywords. ¬†
If match is close to "Partner Only" ‚Üí output "Partner Only Change". ¬†
If match is close to "Specific Perk" ‚Üí output "Specific Perk Change". ¬†
Otherwise, return "".
---

# Output Format
JSON only ‚Äî no explanation, no comments

input.Subject:: Subject: New SMARTY Promo for Unidays
input.Cc::
Cc: UK-Smarty <uk-smarty@awin.com>, George Howe <george.howe@three.co.uk>,
Jak McLoughlin <jak.mcloughlin@summitmedia.com>


Hi Callum,

Hope all is well!

SMARTY has a new promo live; can you schedule its upload for us, please? üòä
input.Promo:: Promo: 60GB for ¬£8 (40GB plan with ¬£2 off + 20GB promo data add on)
input.https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=:
https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=10933&awinaffid=122965&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fsmarty.co.uk%2Fplans%2F40gb-data%3Fvc%3D15Mth60GB8Apr25AffALL



Let me know if you have any questions!

Best,
Henry

-- 
Saf Burki
Senior Salesforce Administrator

metadata.prompt:
# Role & Task
You are an expert Salesforce Operations Analyst tasked with extracting key partner request information from raw email data submitted as part of a Salesforce case.
You are provided with:
- An unstructured email body containing details related to a promotional or perk request by a partner.
- Optional (extra fields) pertaining to the missing information which was not available within the original email.

# Objective
Your goal is to extract and structure key information required for the processing of partner cases. The fields that need to be extracted are:  
Email Subject, Email Body, Production Ops Type, Contact Name, Contact Email, Perk Type, Deploy When Ready (True/False), Region, Go-Live Date, Go-Live Time, End Date, End Time, Member Target, Code Batch To Be Used, Attachments (Y/N), Requested By, URL, T&Cs, Misc Change.
metadata.node: Extract All Case Information From ADM's Email 1
